required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunological Effects of Two Mistletoe Preparations in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Immunological Effects of Iscucin Populi and Viscum Mali e Planta Tota in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this clinical trial is to describe safety, tolerability and the course of parameters of the immune system during administration of different doses of two subcutaneously administered mistletoe preparations (Iscucin populi and Viscum Mali e planta tota) in healthy volunteers, compared to placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: After 4 weeks treatment with each dose
primary_outcome.description: Week 4 after baseline: evaluation of Iscucin populi strength F and Viscum Mali D3, respectively, compared to placebo. Week 8 after baseline: evaluation of Iscucin populi strength G and Viscum Mali D2, respectively, compared to placebo. Week 12 after baseline: evaluation of Iscucin populi strength H and Viscum mali 2%, respectively, compared to placebo. Week 16 after baseline: final follow up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 4 weeks treatment with each dose
After 4 weeks treatment with each dose
After 4 weeks treatment with each dose
After 4 weeks treatment with each dose
After 4 weeks treatment with each dose

secondary_outcome.measure: General tolerability of the treatment(excellent, good, moderate or bad)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 4 weeks treatment with each dose
secondary_outcome.description: see primary outcome measure. Toleability will be indicated by the participants on a 4-point rating scale with the items "excellent", "good", "moderate" or "bad", which will be coded by 1, 2, 3 or 4.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Iscucin populi strength F, G and H
arm_group.description: 1 ampoule two times/week subcutaneously. Week 1-4: strength F. Week 5-8: strength G. Week 9-12: strength H.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Viscum Mali e planta tota D3, D2, 2%
arm_group.description: 1 ampoule two times a week subcutaneously. Week 1-4: D3. Week 4-8: D2. Week 9-12: 2%.
1 ampoule two times a week subcutaneously

intervention.arm_group_label: Iscucin populi strength F, G and H
Viscum Mali e planta tota D3, D2, 2%

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-45 years. Healthy volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any disease except hay fever.
- Smoking.
- Drug abuse.
- Pregnancy

link.description: Center for Complementary Medicine, University Hospital Freiburg
